text: The 1964–65 Algerian Championnat National was the third season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 16 teams contested the league, with USM Annaba as the defending champions. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 1964-1965 * SCM Oran * RC Kouba * JSM Skikda Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 1965-1966 * MC Alger * JSM Tiaret * USM Alger ==League table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" !scope="col"| !scope="col"|Goalscorer !scope="col"|Team !scope="col"|Goals |- |rowspan=3 align="center"|1 | Hocine Saâdi |NA Hussein Dey |rowspan=3 align="center"|19 |- | Messaoud Koussim |ES Sétif |- | Hassan Achour |CR Belcourt |- |align="center"|4 | Noureddine Hachouf |ES Guelma |align="center"|18 |- |rowspan=2 align="center"|5 | Karim Hamida |MC Oran |rowspan=2 align="center"|13 |- | Hacène Lalmas |CR Belcourt |- |align="center"|7 | Abderrahmane Meziani |USM Alger |align="center"|11 |- |rowspan=5 align="center"|8 | Zoubir Aouedj |MC Alger |rowspan=5 align="center"|10 |- | Abdelhakim Hadjou |USM Annaba |- | Mbarek Chenane |CR Belcourt |- | Souidi Benaïssa |JSM Tiaret |- | Abdelkader Reguig |ASM Oran |} ===Hat-tricks=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
